September 17, 1956
Hr* Tom Hall, Jr.
Assistant to the
Director of Public Relations
Wofford College,
Spartanburg, South Carolina.
Dear Hr. Hall*
In reply to your recent request, we would like to give you information
regarding membership in the National Association of Educational BroadÂ¬
casters.
The NAEB has three categories of membership, as follows*
Active - Educational ins, utions, public service organizations, etc.
owning and operating their own radio and/or television stations.
Associate - Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but operating
production centers and regularly producing programs over
a commercial outlet.
Affiliate - Any organization or individual interested in the general
furtherance of educational broadcasting.
For Active members with radio stations, dues in the association are based
on rated transmitter power, as follows*
Class A - 5 kw and over - 150.00
Class B - 1 - 4.9 kw - 25.00
Class C - less than 1 kw- 15.00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay $50.00 and those
with 5 kw or more video power pay $100.00.
Associate and Affiliate members pay $10.00 a year. For this fee members
receive our monthly Newsletter* the various reports and surveys we publish
periodically; services of our Placement Service, television engineer, legal
counsel, management consultant, etc.; plus the normal day to day services,
information, and advice that any national organization gives its members.
Under separate cover we are sending you samples of some of the materials
we regularly send our members, plus other items which will give you more
information about the Association. Of course. Associate and Affiliate
members do not receive as many of these materials as regularly as Active
members do.
